snippet: In its ambitious plan to end homelessness among veterans, the federal government should make sure that it protects the vulnerable population of women.
abstract: Editorial argues that the Veterans Affairs Department must ensure that their five-year plan to end homelessness among veterans also protects the vulnerable population of women, whose risks and needs can be far different from those of men; cites two studies finding that the VA has so far done a poor job of defending female veterans against sexual harassment and assault.
lead_paragraph: In its ambitious plan to end homelessness among veterans, the federal government should make sure that it protects the vulnerable population of women.
